website_summaries.verdict: A terrific option for those who want to improve their golf swing mechanics as quickly as possible.
pros: weighted head that helps simultaneously strengthen swing and boost muscle memory
Designed for advanced or novice golfers
cons: May be too heavy for some users

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Was enjoying the SKLZ Gold Flex for less than a month of light use when the grip became unattached while warming up at course. Grip remained in hand while the ‘business end’ was slung about 15 yards toward a group of people. Very dangerous! Called customer support and voice mailbox was full. Link to customer support website on this Amazon page is a broken link. Disappointed...was already seeing some results after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Santino A. Biscoglia

customer_reviews.title: Feel the difference.
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been very beneficial to me in regaining yardage with my driver. It helps with timing and not over-swinging. It provides a muscle memory that is hard to achieve when my mechanics were off. I have been making better contact more consistently. You feel when you do it right and problem with your swing feels wrong in a way that is intuitively easy to fix. Love it and use it before every round and many longer holes.
customer_reviews.author: KEAJ

customer_reviews.title: Handle comes off easily
customer_reviews.text: As happened to numerous other buyers, the handle came off mid swing after about a week of use. It almost broke my fence 20 feet in front of me. Just glad no one was standing there. I did find the trainer to be useful before it broke. But since others have had the same thing happen, I can only assume the product is defective. I'll have to try one of the other trainers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I used the product for about 10 minutes and the shaft slid out of the handle!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hurtubise

customer_reviews.title: "Must-have" golf swing trainer
customer_reviews.text: Good golf trainer for reinforcing correct tempo for the swing and also to reinforce correct swing plane and proper hip, shoulder, body turn along with correct arm motion and follow-thru. Good for strength training, too. Pretty much the Swiss knife of golf trainers. I would consider this the most essential arrow in my quiver of (many) golf training items. Less than half the price of the orange whip yet does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: C2CO

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but not a ton of benefit for me indoors in the winter. Way too long for indoors. Fine outside. That yellow ball at the end is pretty solid so don't plan on hitting thing with it. I feel the flex is right for my swing speed, not sure how it will be for everyone else's. I have a fast transition tempo and this is forcing me to slow it down. I've found that to be a good thing. (Driver swing speed 101-106 mph.) My hands can break free a bit though at transition. It's not light, so if you transition too fast it is a lot of weight transfer on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware Of Defective Grip
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 29th, 2019, used the product about 4 times before having the grip fall off. See picture attached, may be worth buying the Orange Whip rather than this knock off.
customer_reviews.author: James Bellman

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid.
customer_reviews.text: I am 62 years old and play golf 3 times per week. I've used the swing tool for a couple of days before I headed to the course. I used it to warm up and my playing partner wanted to try it. I am a 1 handicap and i could tell a big difference after a couple of days. 1 club longer with irons. I hit my longest drive on the 4th hole, 30 yards past my norm. Excited about the progress in such a short time. Also, my playing partner ordered one for himself.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Handle snapped off mid swing
customer_reviews.text: I took this product right out of the box, took 10 swings and the grip snapped off sending the club flying across the room. This will be sent back ASAP! Customer service said they would send me a replacement a month ago and still haven’t received it.
customer_reviews.author: CAMERON

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but not quite there....
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal: This product is well made and is priced right; however, for me it bends way too much. So much so that it doesn't feel like a regular wood. Your tempo is fine while swinging it, but then transferring over to your driver, with a much stiffer shaft, the tempo doesn't carry over. If this were made with a flexibility just a bit more than a, say, regular shaft, a person couldn't create more accurate muscle memory and tempo for use on the course. (If you want to buy mine and can figure out how to contact me through Amazon, I'll let you have it for $29.95 and shipping. I've only swung it twice.)
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It came apart while swinging!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to report this on the website. The link did not work. It worked fine for the first few weeks of use. Then the shaft broke from the grip while I swung it. I was left with grip in my hand while the weighted ball and shaft flew off at high speed and almost hit someone! Could have been a lawsuit. I want a refund!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Nice Swing Trainer - Needs a Mid-Size Grip Option
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a very good swing trainer. It does help with swing rhythm, path, and my flexibility. Hopefully it will show up on the course with more distance and lower scores. Time will tell. I will join those who voiced a little concern or unhappiness with the grip. I prefer a mid-size grip. The grip on the trainer is too small or thin. I wish they offered a mid-size grip option as it would then be perfect. And I am hearing I cannot replace it with any grip. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Barry S

customer_reviews.title: Helps stretch,
customer_reviews.text: As a 5-handicapper, who needs an 89 g driver shaft, I found this to be of minimal benefit. The only positive I earn from this device is aids the pre-round stretch a bit. It’s much too light to build any strength....For the beginner this may be of great benefit for building tempo and/or the proper plane.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F

customer_reviews.title: Good Warm Up Stretch Tool
customer_reviews.text: At half the price of the Orange Whip, I took a shot at this hoping to help my golfing full swing and especially driver game. Jury is still out if it's making things better but I can definitely say it helps with tempo and getting me to turn a little more in the shoulders and trunk. When one gets a little older, sometimes flexibility wanes. Here's to hoping this thing will help keep me a bit more pliable in the full swing.
customer_reviews.author: japhakrfnb

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: 3rd time using it, 1 week into owning it, it broke, flew up in the air and into my neighbors yard.....I was still holding the grip, and only the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin weg

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the trainer length
customer_reviews.text: Too long for a standard driver and cannot choke down enough to simulate other clubs without the end of the SKLZ trainer getting in the way. I'm 5'8" and had to return it for the shorter 40". Unless you're about 6'0", the 48" is too long. Otherwise great product comparable to Orange whip ball trainer for more economical price.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Ball end separating from the grip when ever swinging it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 SKLZ Goldflex 40’s. The grips on both of them slid off when I swing them. The weighted ball end has flown/separated from the grip end in a course parking lot (hitting a car) and in my bedroom (hitting a wall). I tried to superglue the grip to stop it from happening again but to no avail. Be careful guys. I tried calling to see if they would replace the 2 but couldn’t get through. I will call again on Monday. I really like them but I want ones that stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Matmac

customer_reviews.title: Tempo Tempo Tempo
customer_reviews.text: I didn't understand the impact of tempo on my swing until trying this trainer. Improved play after the first time. Something clicked for me when I swung this, yes am a beginner, but have been practicing off and on for years and had most of the fundamental parts of swing down otherwise. This trainer has improved my swing confidence, resulting in more consistent shots, and most importantly increased club head speed.
customer_reviews.author: chrisk

customer_reviews.title: Good Training Aid
customer_reviews.text: I recently took a lesson with my local golf pro, and he had me swinging the SKLZ Gold Flex to emphasize the correction he wanted to make in my swing. It was so helpful I went home and ordered one. A few minutes in the back yard with it several times a week has helped me smooth out my swing. I'll never be a good golfer, but golf is a lot more fun when I can be somewhat consistent in my game.
customer_reviews.author: Arkansas Traveler

customer_reviews.title: I tried it and loved it enough to buy one for myself
customer_reviews.text: A friend bought the Orange Whip Trainer for something more than a hundred dollars. I tried it and loved it enough to buy one for myself. With a little research, I found this product. Practically identical except for color and half the money. I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to improve the tempo of their golf swing. It certainly has improved my game.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Good training aid. Handle separating
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good device. I can swing repeatedly at a mental Target and get pretty good feedback. It's preventing me from over swinging or abbreviating my swing. It gets two stars because the handle is separating from the shaft. I can probably fix it with some glue but really? Got this one for way less than MSRP.
customer_reviews.author: PENNAME

customer_reviews.title: Great golf swing aid!
customer_reviews.text: Love this training aid. It instantly helped me with slicing the ball when driving. It has helped me add yards to my drives and has made me more flexible in my golf swing and hip movements. I highly recommend it if you’re looking for an aid that will give you immediate improvement in your golf swing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic must-have!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trainer for high handicappers and new golfers. This really gives you a feel of where the acceleration/kick ought to be. I let my friend who just started golfing this season use this mid-round and he went from zooming the ball just above the ground to getting proper flight after a few minutes with this trainer. This also works fantastic for warming up cold muscles and getting tempo honed mid-round. Also good to get a few swings in nightly as a workout..
customer_reviews.author: The smiley face on Amazon means A to Z -- CRAZY!

customer_reviews.title: Handle came off mid-swing and put a hole in my ceiling
customer_reviews.text: Check out all of the reviews and pictures of people who have had issues with the grip coming off. The grip is not very well glued on and slides off during the swing. Poor build or QC issues. Not only am I out $40 for this training aid, but now I have to fix a hole in the ceiling. Just glad it didn't go through a window.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer King

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to warm up and to keep loose during a round
customer_reviews.text: Excellent golf tool. I use this to warmup before I play. I use it another way that many golfers will understand: Have you ever played a round of golf behind SLOW players? While you sit in the cart waiting to play your shot, you feel your muscles tightening up. You take practice swings to stay loose but it doesn't always help. Now I take out this trainer and take 3-4 swings and I'm loose again. Buy it and keep it in your bag!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff and Suzette Rahn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helps with tempo...don't keep it in your bag if you have a-hole friends
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Incredible results - got my game back on track
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced golfer and was having major trouble with consistency with my driver - always too quick with my swing and resulted in mis-hits all over. I bought this after reading reviews and swung it 20-30 times per night for 2 weeks before playing. I noticed immediate results and was hitting the ball straighter and further than I had before. It breaks any bad habits you develop by getting your tempo down and forces you to follow through your swing. I took a few swings with it mid round too just to keep me in check. Would HIGHLY recommend for any golfer, novice or advanced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swing away
customer_reviews.text: This is a durable, well-made product. The only reason I’m giving it a 4 is because it’s a bit long for me. We have one at our course that is a little shorter and easier for my 5’4 body to swing. I’m an 18 handicap and like to use these for warm-up. It works, it’s just a little harder to control. Perfect for tall women or men.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gumm

customer_reviews.title: Best golf training aid ever invented. From a scratch golfer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a scratch golfer. In the last 6 months I had lost 20-30 yards in my driver and at least one club shorter on the irons. A professional golfer recommended this and swore by it. Within 2 weeks I have gotten my yardage back, along with 10 times the flexibility I had prior. I've used 100s of training aids over the years. This product is by far the best ever invented for increased length, flexibility and getting your weight shift and golf club on plane in the shortest time possible. I've gotten 3 other people to order this and all 3 are just totally amazed at their improvements in no time at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bettye Davis

customer_reviews.title: Own both and like them for different reasons
customer_reviews.text: Own both and like them for different reasons. Shorter one feels like a club and longer one like a driver. If I had to choose I would go with the 48 because it’s heavier.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: The best training aid I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to increase the flexibility of my golf swing. I practiced for 5 minutes every couple of days for 2 weeks. My first time on the course the distance of my drives increased by 20 yards. All other club distances went up at least 10 yards. Additionally, my shots were straighter. Now, my new problem is adjusting to the extra distance! The SKLZ Goldflex (48 inch) works far better than I imagined!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps with distance and accuracy
customer_reviews.text: First off, I'm not claiming to be an expert on the golf swing. But, I can tell you that swinging this device for 5-10 minutes in backyard a couple of times per week has greatly increased my driver length and accuracy. Occasionally I will carry it in my bag during a round and always get asked what it is. After using it on the course a few times, one of my buddies actually purchased his own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jury's still out
customer_reviews.text: Fun to swing, and you can feel it "working." But has it improved my golf game... eh. Not so much. Granted, I could have used it more, and worked harder. But if I was going to do those things, I probably wouldn't need this. So one star off for making me think it would help. Four stars for me having should've known better.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Training Aid
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the Orange Whip but after doing some research purchased the SKLZ Gold Flex. Saved a bunch of money and love the product. This is the best golf aid I've purchased. I use them all, but this accomplishes so much and all you have to do is swing it. I leave it in my bag and use it to warm up with. My tempo is much better and I'm getting a little more distance because I'm starting to draw the ball. If you are serious about improving your swing, this is the product to own.
customer_reviews.author: K Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Aid - Poor Construction
customer_reviews.text: I really like the SKLZ Gold Flex Golf Swing Trainer Warm-Up Stick and try to use it everyday to work on my flexibility and swing plane. It's cheaper than the Orange Whip and I guess I found out why. The grip doesn't appear to be glued onto the shaft. I have to stop and re-position the grip after every 10 swings or so because the shaft starts to slip out of the grip. I'm disappointed and will have to take it somewhere to get it glued.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Danger

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the bag.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. My usual course doesn't have a range and I usually head straight to the first hole without not a lot of warm up. Now I use this for a few swings prior and since I've hit the 200 yard pat 3 green almost every time since. I also got this at a time my iron play was struggling and it helped reset my swing and square my club head at impact. Definitely a must carry in the bag. I suggest all my playing partners warm up with this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C

customer_reviews.title: Best product for the best price. It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for growing your swing and getting warmed up. I find myself using it during play just to perfect my swing. Don't spend $100+ for the expensive one. This is better quality, less money and gets the exact same results.
customer_reviews.author: Expect the Best

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I found this very helpful. Use it between rounds to stay loose and keep muscle's ready. Use it to get warmed up before rounds. This will help you slow down your back swing, which is very helpful for most of us hackers. My game has improved 4-6 strokes a round since I started using it, make better contact, ball carries further, etc.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Swing Practice At Home
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great to increase range of motion and to build those muscles needed to hit the ball. I feel this in my back, arms, and hips after just a few minutes of swinging. The way I use it is just start with a slow rhythm back and forth, then build up to a faster swing to get momentum. You will figure it out pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the handle is properly glued onto the shaft
customer_reviews.text: My first day out on the driving range, I began warming up with my new SKLZ training aid when the handle slipped off the shaft and shaft flew about 50 yards out onto the range luckily not hitting someone. Haven’t glided the handle back on yet and it’s still sitting in my golf bag. Very disappointed !!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer & warm up tool.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 68 and have back problems that restrict my backswing. 5-10 minutes use before playing has added 10-20 yds to my drives and helped me drop down an iron for approach’s. More interesting is using a mat showed me I drop the club more inside than I thought. Now addressing my diver on the heel and getting more center face hits.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. George

customer_reviews.title: Perfect warm up tool.
customer_reviews.text: Since I purchased this it is the only thing I use before warming up. No more hitting range balls before a round. The Gold Flex helps me loosen up and get my swing plane set before the first tee. I have the 40” one and it is fine. I probably should have gone with the 48” one. But you can’t go wrong with either.
customer_reviews.author: tehuti

customer_reviews.title: This thing WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different swing training aids of different shapes and sizes and this is for real! It has helped my tempo and lag and honestly can say I have picked up 10 yards mostly with irons and 5 with Driver and fairway woods. I only work with it 2 to maybe 3 days a week on the range for 5 minutes so I'm going to put more time into it around the house. The only negative can't help me putt!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: This thing works, helps with tempo and more so with swing path for me. I have a tendency to come over the top, this has helped. Swing it in front of a mirror or window where you can watch. If your tempo improves you will find yourself swinging from the inside with forward lean. Know how to swing the right way before you pick this up. It should help take a proper swing to the next level. I also use to warm up on the tee and at the driving range. Great addition to the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, helps with your follow through and the club feels extremely light after swinging the SKLZ. Use it before every round and ven at home when not able to play. Highly recommended, I’m 6,3 so bought the longest version. My fellow golfers are shorter and are still comfortable using this length so unless you are really short i would recommend the longer one.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Great for warm ups!
customer_reviews.text: People think i was scammed into buying this but its great for warm up as its heavy and really opens up the body before a round of golf especially in cold weather! I dont know if it helps with swing/tempo training as i didnt use it for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Raza H.

customer_reviews.title: an excellent golf warm up and training aid
customer_reviews.text: this device was exactly what i was expecting it is great for loosening up and also showing what a full turn and good tempo should feel like
customer_reviews.author: m. harty

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for tempo and stretching out
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this tool! Really a great way to stretch before a round. I've also notice it certainly helps with your tempo. I'm hitting the ball a little further when I warm up with this, over not warming up with it. You can even skip the range to warm up with this in your bag
customer_reviews.author: cld1119

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a bad back and want to work on trying to get it better so I can play golf again. I bought a piece of artificial grass on Amazon and I use this in my driveway. I just started so I am only swinging it about 15-20 times and plan on building up from there.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R

customer_reviews.title: Shaft splitting
customer_reviews.text: It has been great for warming up amd tempo. I am only a little over a month in and the shaft is splitting ope under the grip. Can’t see it lasting much longer. It’s too bad because I really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Allen

customer_reviews.title: separated from grip
customer_reviews.text: Was actually okay until it broke. I was just warming up in my front yard before heading to the course. The shaft separated from the grip and bounced off my neighbor's garage door. Other people have noted the same problem. Item is probably too dangerous to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best, it will forever stay in my golf bag. I use it every single time I golf, right before I start the 1st hole and through out the day when I have time. Great for getting that hard whip into your swing (it added yardage to my drive), great for stretching, helps keep swing plain consistent and much more. It's well crafted and just a must have especially for new golfers. I HIGHLY recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Grip slid off on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple product made with a critical flaw. First time I used it, the grip slid off. Terrible quality control issue if not a terrible design shortcut. No adhesive to secure the grip. Very easily fixed with one wrap of grip tape, apply solvent, and slide grip on. Had this flown into someone or something breakable, there would be more than this review come forth.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Heston

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had one with the orange ball and it worked great. I let a friend use it once and he said he needed to get one. I priced them and the orange ones were pretty expensive. I found this on Amazon and bought it for my friend. He said it works as well as the orange one that I have.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This is a great training aid
customer_reviews.text: After a handful of swings I immediately could appreciate the assistance with tempo. If you swing it several times, it really gets the heart going, too. I actually look forward to taking a few swings when I can sneak out of the house. This is a great training aid, along with a great way to warm up before playing.
customer_reviews.author: patrick fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great warmup tool!
customer_reviews.text: I used to warmup swinging two clubs, usually the 7 and 8 iron, but it was unorthodox and didn't help me feal the swing since i was griping two clubs. This has made my warmups so much better because it allows me to feel the natural path pf my swing. I got the 48in and it really helped with my swing path for the driver. Highly recommend this for folks looking to warm up better and get ready for the first swing off the tee if they don't have time to hit a bucket of balls before their round. It's also great to use during the round if you feel like you are losing your swing between holes.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Swing Improvement
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous product which has helped me slow down my swing. First time on the course today since I used the SkLZ Gold Flex and I actually drove the ball much better and long fairway shots also fared better - it helped me with letting the club do the work and not my need to kill the ball. My swing did slow down. Now, as any golfer knows, tomorrow is another day and I could be back to playing crap.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I've tried many swing devices and this is the best yet. You can't help but make a golf ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a well seasoned golfer who still needs help with timing weight shift and the hit. I've tried many swing devices and this is the best yet. You can't help but make a golf swing using this thing. Great for warming up before playing.,too. I saw it on the range being used by not one but two good senior golfers, and ordered one for myself. I chose the the 40 inch length so I could use it in the house, and it is plenty long enough to give me all the work out I need.
customer_reviews.author: edenton

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a donut for a baseball bat
customer_reviews.text: Love it never drove the ball better than after I used this product. I feel this helps all swings but specifically the driver. It makes your body feel the motion of transition from backswing to frontswing. Highly recommend it. The 46 seems long and so I think the driver it simulates better. Possibly get the 40 inch if you want iron practice, I might get both.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Crossley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training tool for your golf swing
customer_reviews.text: This tool has really helped pace my swing. Before using it I was rushing my downswing, now I have solid contact and it really makes my irons feel light in my hand. If you use it alot you will break a sweat for sure.. But I use it every time I hit the range..
customer_reviews.author: JAMES R. HAINER

customer_reviews.title: Great for loosening-up sore golf muscles!
customer_reviews.text: A great tool to stretch out those golf muscles and improve flexibility in your swing. I don't think using it will add 30 yards to your tee shots, but it can certainly improve the tempo and timing of your swing. I'm well pleased with mine!
customer_reviews.author: Golfjim175

customer_reviews.title: I have thought to exchange to 40 inches but I am pretty sure it will be too short
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 7" female and bought 48 inches after reading the review & Q&A. But it's way too long. I have thought to exchange to 40 inches but I am pretty sure it will be too short. :( Returned. Update : I bought it again in 40 inches and it's much better than longer one for me(5' 7") and my husband(5' 12") I purchase it on "Prime Now" day and it was about $35.00.
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEY KIM

customer_reviews.title: Great item for learning tempo and to warm up
customer_reviews.text: After seeing a number of YouTube videos I bought this. It's really helped me warm up quicker before a round and to also work on my tempo so that I can 'feel' the club head. If I had to do over again, I would get the longer stick.
customer_reviews.author: Buddha

customer_reviews.title: What a great work out
customer_reviews.text: What a great work out. CAn feel the increased speed in my swing with my clubs. I did notice that I could easily get into bad habits. Over swinging, hands getting away from the body, not rolling my hands through the zone, right elbow getting away from my body. I now concentrate on those things when using the Trainer, adjusted my tempo accordingly. Yellow ball on the end gives a good visual for where I contact the floor. I am 5'11" and bought the shorter Trainer to swing in the living room, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Guy_in_IL

customer_reviews.title: Grip comes off...
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this product until the grip came loose a few days into having it. I sent it back, for a new one sent and the same thing happened again. I haven’t swung it all that much and both times there is a “pop” sound and the grip comes loose causing the shaft and weighted end to feel like it’s going to fly off.
customer_reviews.author: kea

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works
customer_reviews.text: Great way to warm up instead of hitting range balls ( I golf 5 times a week). I also use it, swinging about a dozen times or so, around the house just to keep my mind used to the follow thru. I was always limber, so that's not why I got it. What it does for me is make me follow thru on the swing vs stopping after hitting the ball. The follow thru has now entered into my golf swing, and with good results. This thing whips around and forces to you to complete your follow thru. High recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Add tempo to your swing
customer_reviews.text: Helps my swing tremendously. I can’t tell a difference between this one and the original orange whip. I use it before hitting any balls and it really helps to loosen up my muscles and get my tempo going. I have a bad habit of bringing my arms through before my lower body, and this helps with my timing. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Kickham

customer_reviews.title: Great for loosing up before teeing off and driving range full swings
customer_reviews.text: I am a mid single-digit handicap and I think my swing plane is where it should be but the benefit I get from this swing trainer is to loosen up in the correct way prior to a round of golf or before driving range swings.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Tuik

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to warm up with ore just work on your swing when you feel like it. It can be carried in your golf and it helps you self correct your swing so you can warm up with this before tee off. All around a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I will never swing my driver at a golf ball again without first swinging this training tool 5-10 times first. Great for that warm up stratch. I added 30 yard onto my drive and no more slice.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: great tool for training and warm-up before playing golf
customer_reviews.text: i'm don't usually buy training aids/tools but i found this one to be very helpful. i'm playing golf again after a couple of year lay-off due to a busy schedule. def helps build/train those golf muscles and is a very useful tool to warm up before playing.
customer_reviews.author: JFD

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I received my SKLZ Gold Flex , and have been using it for the last several days. It has made a difference in the way that I swing all of the clubs in the bag. Most impressive is the Driver. Use the Gold Flex, then pick up the driver, and it seems like swing speed has significantly increased.
customer_reviews.author: George Moura

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product! I read all the reviews prior to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product! I read all the reviews prior to ordering the trainer and based on the overwhelmingly good reviews I placed the order. I have used the trainer for several weeks now and have had my lowest scores ever. My drives are 15 to 20 yards longer. My significant other has also realized the same increase in distance. We find it helps with tempo, weight transfer and follow through. I am always very skeptical about training aides but I am very glad I placed the order for this one. The reviews were very helpful in convincing me so I thought I would add my good experience to the many other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good trainer
customer_reviews.text: well i must have had a better swing than I thought...it's a great warmup tool but i didn't feel too much difference from my normal swing. HOWEVER, some days I feel quicker than others and have only had a chance to use it several times but overall great product. Looks a little funny I do like the smaller version (even though it looks like it's for women) it resembles an iron better and for a driver its easier to just extend out a bit and this one is easier to carry in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Worked great UNTIL grip came off, after the tenth swing!
customer_reviews.text: Product is not very well made and I will have to repair. Grip came off after only 10 swings and I'm 66 years old, so I don't swing hard or fast, anymore! Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Check the length
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the stick I didn't know there were two sizes. I don't recall that the front page of the order form talked about two different lengths or gave me an option. I work at a country club and only have seen the 48 in. stick. The 40 in. stick really doesn't do anything. It doesn't provide the feedback on flex that the 48 in stick does. It is too stiff. It may be good for irons, but does not give feedback for using a driver. And, I don't want two of them in my bag. Some day I'll order the 48 in.
customer_reviews.author: 4Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Best golf swing trainer
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible. When you swing this slowly it automatically puts you in the perfect body positions. I only wish it was legal to take each preshot practice swing with this item. I was having trouble finishing each shot with a full turn and this fixed that. I highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: pierre

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent swing tool - really helps you feel and create lag. Also good exercise for any age. For the people breaking them: don't hit the ground. It's not a golf club.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm up tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help loosen up and stretch those muscles before a round or range session. I bought the 48" long version because it says it was meant for people 5'6" or taller, well I'm 5'7" and it takes some getting use to. I would suggest going with the 40" if your 5'8" or shorter. Still a good aid though and I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This works fine, however the handle is slipping off after only ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fine, however the handle is slipping off after only a few uses. I find this to be cheaply made and not worth the money paid for this.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: Great aid for decide swing
customer_reviews.text: Great warn up and range of swing tool. I am 6 foot and bought the longer version. I might have selected the smaller to simulate iron swings. The longer version feels like it is a training aid for your wood and hybrid swings.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Cantando

customer_reviews.title: Nice workout
customer_reviews.text: I got the longer one for Christmas and I really like it. It does seem to grove the correct swing path It helps stretch and loosen me up before the round and it is a good workout. I swing it for five minutes and I'm winded.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Watson III

customer_reviews.title: Solid alternative to the orange whip.
customer_reviews.text: Solid alternative to the orange whip. You need to watch some videos on how to use the item and maybe take instruction about tempo. Once you understand how the flex is supposed to be used you will get much more out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first but decided to give it a try after reading all of the great reviews and very happy I did. Great combination of building strength, flexibility and tempo all in one swing trainer. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: chaz

customer_reviews.title: It increased by distance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the SKLZ last year. I swing it a minimum of 20 swings per day since then, I increased my distance with all my clubs especially with my driver. I've purchased many golf training aids and this is the best. I'm 73 years old, and I'm able to make a full turn in my backswing and pause at the top which accounts for the increased yardage. JAB
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is fantastic. It has helped my tempo and synchronization tremendously
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. It has helped my tempo and synchronization tremendously. I have been piping my tee shots down the middle of the fairway. I use it before I hit balls on range, and even during the round when I feel my swing getting out of sync. I would recommend this to anyone that needs help with their tempo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the driving range
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this training tool, it helps me with my swing. I take it to the driving range with me, along with my 3-wood and my driver. Before I use those two clubs, I swing the SKLZ four or five times, and then use these other clubs. It helps me with the swing, especially with keeping my left arm straight in the back swing, and with completing my follow-through. I highly recommend it to improve the swing.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great golf trainer at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This item is nationally advertised at higher price than Amazon, so I bought it. It's a great training aid to get proper feel for correct golf swing tempo, as well as building swing strength.
customer_reviews.author: C C Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid....
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great training aid, it helps you warm up at the range or before a round. It helps with controlling tempo and lag. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jose DFW

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I use this as means of stretching my back out instead of using 2-3 irons for warm up. I like it and seems to help me out. I also like that it helps to maintain a fluid swinging motion. Worth the money in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Trae Hutsell

customer_reviews.title: It’s also good for warming up before using your driver
customer_reviews.text: I use it whenever I get the itch to golf. If your ceiling is high enough, you can use it inside. It gives a decent work out and helps with my rhythm. It’s also good for warming up before using your driver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stretch out before hitting the links
customer_reviews.text: I use it to keep loose at home, but more importantly, loosen up before a round. Really alleviates the stiffness of the first two holes, this thing will save you strokes.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Brewers

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have a issue of not shifting my weight in my swing. This tool fixed that. My score is still too high but hey, nobody said this was a miracle tool.
customer_reviews.author: Otto56

customer_reviews.title: Quality good, limited effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: Does not provide the timing and power touted by the ad
customer_reviews.author: Swing man

customer_reviews.title: I have a one plane(ish) swing and the 40 inch is a better fit for me
customer_reviews.text: ATTENTION TALL PEOPLE: I am 6'5" and had the 48 inch. I have a one plane(ish) swing and the 40 inch is a better fit for me. More like a real club as far as my stance and address goes. HOPE this helps....
customer_reviews.author: Curious Guy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: On the 3rd time I used this training tool it the grip became unglued from the shaft and flung across my yard. I ordered it in Jan. and didn't use it until late spring and now It is past the return date. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ok there are more expensive types that exceed $100 ~ don’t bother this does exactly the same for less. Sturdy and long enough enough for me 6’2” in height. Great find
customer_reviews.author: Vic Mosby

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I can swing it in the house which for me is perfect as I have virtually no room outside to use any practice nets or similar gadgets. I generally swing it 10-20 times per day and can feel it straightening out my swing plane and increasing my swing speed. I used to pull out 2 clubs at the driving range or course to warm up my arms but this feels much better and increases my control as well as warming me up. Just a great toy to have around!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Goldey

customer_reviews.title: Great overall game improvement tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a pre round stretching tool and it has proven to be a lot more. This is a great tempo tool and will greatly improve your golf game. This training tool has improved my consistency in ball striking and not 5 strokes off my game. Now I just need something to improve my putting
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: SKLZ GOLD FREX GOLF SWING TRAINER WARM-UP STICK
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this golf swing trainer warm-up stick. He was pleased to find this at such a good price, and is very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: joy keaton

product_meta.title: SKLZ Gold Flex Golf Swing Trainer Warm-Up Stick
product_meta.description:
The SKLZ Gold Flex Trainer is the ideal tool to perfect your swing so you can get the score you want, every time you step onto the course. Use it when or warming up before a game and get a low-impact stretch for easier mobility. With a weighted head made of durable polyurethane, and a flexible fiberglass shaft, you’ll build muscle and power with every swing. Work the fundamental core golf muscles, and tone your obliques as you gain muscle memory. Let your perfect swing become more of a habit, and less of a practice. Simply swing this training aid while learning lag and elimination of early release. Available in either 40” or 48" in length with a 2.5 lb. head, this flexible weighted trainer encourages a flatter swing plane and forces the downswing to be initiated by the lower body, helping to reduce slices. The 48” is recommended for individuals 5’6” or taller, or those who are stronger and more advanced in their golf game. The 40” length is ideal for those who are under 5’6” or who are at a beginner or intermediate level. Made of high quality, durable materials, you can feel confident that you will be able to use the SKLZ Gold Flex Golf Trainer for years to come. Investing in high quality sports equipment and training tools, means you’re investing in your athletic goals.

AMAZON.COM
Now you can warm up just like the top tour professionals with the SKLZ Power Sleeve. A popular choice among a host of golf pros, the Power Sleeve fits snugly on your club shaft, in effect turning any club in your bag into a weighted club. As a result, the sleeve makes it easy to loosen up before your round, build golf muscles and flexibility, and even to hit balls to identify and fix swing flaws. The sleeve works by ingraining the feel of the correct swing path into your muscle memory, helping you hit longer, straighter shots and boosting your flexibility. Even better, the Power Sleeve slips on and off easily, so you won't scratch your shafts when applying it. The Power Sleeve is the perfect tool for warming up or staying in shape during the off-season. 

 



The sleeve ingrains the feel of the correct swing path into your muscle memory. 


The Power Swing attaches easily and won't scratch your shafts. About SKLZ
The flagship brand of Pro Performance Sports LLC, SKLZ was built around the popularity of the company's legendary baseball swing trainer, the Hit-A-Way. After starting with a complete line of baseball and softball trainers, the company expanded into football, tennis, soccer, hockey, lacrosse, and most recently, a full spectrum of golf training products. Headquartered in San Diego, the SKLZ team consists of both seasoned professionals and young upstarts in the sporting goods industry who are passionate about delivering the best skill development products to athletes of all ages.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


GOLD FLEX STRENGTH AND TEMPO TRAINER

The Gold Flex warm-up and tempo training aid is designed to improve your swing while providing a core muscle workout. The Gold Flex encourages a flatter swing plane and forces the downswing to be initiated by the lower body, both of which fight slices.


FEATURES

 * Durable polyurethane head for frequent use
 * Shaft length helps flatten the swing plane
 * 49" in length, 2.5 lb. head
 * Flexible fiberglass shaft teaches lag and helps eliminate early release/casting
 * Golf grip with guidelines for proper hand placement
 * Head weight improves kinetic sequencing in the swing
 * Strengthens core golf muscles
 * Great low-impact stretch for pre-round warm-up
 * Fits easily in golf bag and is legal to carry on course
 * PLEASE NOTE: This product cannot be re-gripped


SIZING GUIDE
Gold Flex 48-inch

Measures 48" in length with a 2.5 lb. head

Generally more appropriate for individuals 5'6" or taller, but individuals under 5'6" who are stronger, or more skilled/experienced will be able to utilize the Gold Flex Original without difficulty.


Gold Flex 40-inch

Measures 40" in length with a 2.5 lb. head

Generally more appropriate for individuals under 5'6", however, individuals under 5'6" who are stronger, or more skilled/experienced will be able to use the longer Gold Flex without difficulty.




ABOUT SKLZ

SKLZ is committed to elevating the athlete in each of us by guiding and serving athletes on their journeys to be their personal best. As the flagship brand of Pro Performance Sports, based in San Diego California, SKLZ develops innovative athletic performance and skill development training products, technology and knowledge for serious athletes of all ages, skill levels and sports including baseball, football, soccer, golf, softball and basketball. SKLZ is known around the world for delivering durable, high-performance training products used by professional and amateur athletes as well as their coaches and trainers seeking to improve on a sport-specific skill or a performance-focused goal such as speed, agility, balance or core strength.







See more
feature_bullets: 10-20 swings every day will improve swing tempo, strength, and flexibility
Easy to use - simply “swing” the Gold Flex back and forth continually without stopping at impact position, as if swinging to a metronome
Fights slices and flattens the swing
Low-impact stretch for pre- round warm-up
Fits easily in golf bag – legal to carry on course
